definition: to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend

sentences.english: If it is lower, they then ask for an adjustment.
sentences.chinese: 假如降价了，他们就要求调价。

sentences.english: Provided that the reduction in price is prorata, we can go along with that.
sentences.chinese: 如果这种降价是成比例的话，我们可以同意。

sentences.english: All video equipment is on sale today and tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 所有录像设备今明两天降价出售。

sentences.english: If you bargain with them , they might reduce the price.
sentences.chinese: 如果你和他们讲价钱，他们可能会降价。

sentences.english: All the jewellery is on sale at the shop.
sentences.chinese: 本店所有珠宝都降价出售。

sentences.english: But a temporary, harvest-related decline in food prices really doesn't change the inflation picture in the medium term.
sentences.chinese: 但暂时性的食品降价并不会改变中长期的通胀格局。

sentences.english: The shop decided to clear off the winter clothes when the new summer fashions arrived.
sentences.chinese: 当新的夏季时装到货以后，该店决定降价出售冬装。

sentences.english: This week 's bargain offer - 30% off all carpet prices.
sentences.chinese: 本周所有地毯价格优惠降价30%。

sentences.english: In the end I cut the dealer down by another ￡5.00.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我使这个商人又降价五英镑。

sentences.english: The newspapers reported that the prices of radio-sets and TV-sets are going to be further reduced.
sentences.chinese: 报上报导说，收音机和电视机将进一步降价。

sentences.english: I heard other stores hxdying great mark- downs on this item.
sentences.chinese: 我听说别的商店这种商品正在大降价。

sentences.english: Many clothes are on sale recently.
sentences.chinese: 最近许多时装都在大降价。

sentences.english: They may also presage a new period of declining prices.
sentences.chinese: 它们可能还预示着新一轮的降价。

sentences.english: Mrs. Sommers knew the value of finding things for sale at reduced prices.
sentences.chinese: 萨默斯太太深知寻找降价销售的物品有多重要。

sentences.english: However, this approach can back fire if it triggers a price-cutting spiral.
sentences.chinese: 然而事与愿违的是，这条途径可能引发商家竞相降价。

definition: to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price
(coll.) to fall or drop in price/to go down in price
to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
to set a price/to fix a price
to raise or lower the price/price adjustment
